The capital is the port city of Antofagasta. ==Geography== The Antofagasta province has an area of . The Antofagasta province is bordered on the north by the Tocopilla and El Loa provinces, on the east by Argentina, on the south by the Atacama region (Chañaral province) and on the west by the Pacific Ocean. ==Population== (last national census), there were 318,779 people living in the province, giving it a population density of inhabitants/km². The largest city of the province is Antofagasta, its capital, with a population, in 2002, of 285,255 inhabitants. ==Administration== As a province, the Antofagasta province is a second-level administrative division, consisting of four communes (comunas). The city of Antofagasta serves as the provincial capital. The province is administered by a governor.
